title: WHAT IS AI? SIMPLE INTRODUCTION TO AI AND WHY IT MATTERS IN MONEY
description: Understanding Artificial Intelligence and how it impacts money decisions.

blocks.content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is one of the emerging technologies that focuses on creating systems that are capable of performing tasks that would typically require human intelligence. AI can perform tasks like understanding language, recognizing patterns, learning from experience, planning, reasoning, and problem solving thus allowing humans to focus on more pressing problems.

items.title: Smart Assistants
items.content: Google Assistant, Siri, and Alexa help you search information, control devices, and manage your schedule through voice commands.

items.title: Search Recommendations
items.content: Platforms like Google track your activity and show recommendations and ads based on your preferences across YouTube and social media.

items.title: For You Pages
items.content: Social media and streaming platforms like Instagram, Netflix, and YouTube show personalized content based on what you have watched or interacted with earlier.

sections.title: How AI Helps in Making Money Decisions

items.title: Google Pay
items.content: Tracks where you spend the most and helps you manage your budget.

items.title: PayTM’s AI
items.content: Suggests savings plans or sends bill reminders based on your spending activity.

items.title: Personal Finance Managers (PFMs)
items.content: Analyze your transaction data to show spending patterns and suggest smarter financial habits.

items.title: Robo-Advisors
items.content: AI-based investment advisors that manage portfolios using algorithms—making investing easier and more efficient.

blocks.content: Apps like Walnut and MoneyView track your spending and provide personalized saving tips depending on where you spend the most—such as food, shopping, or entertainment.

sections.title: Why Should You Care About AI?

blocks.content: AI Helps Manage Your Money Better
AI helps you budget, save money, avoid fraud, track bill payments, and monitor spending habits making financial decisions easier and smarter.
If you use PhonePe or Google Pay, AI categorizes your expenses and notifies you about discounts or deals based on your past spending patterns.
Chatbots are computer programs that use Artificial Intelligence to simulate human-like conversations.
Examples include ChatGPT, Gemini, Deepseek, and Copilot.
Through Natural Language Processing (NLP), chatbots understand human language and respond accurately.

items.title: HDFC Bank’s EVA
items.content: A virtual assistant that answers customer queries 24/7 about transactions, account balances, and loan status.

items.title: ICICI Bank’s iPal
items.content: Helps customers check balances, complete banking tasks, and even recommends products like credit cards and loans.
